column4: my system doesn't go beyond the grub menu. When running the live-cd any of the options the menu provides me just boots the cd again and takes me back to the menu. Anyone had the same issue/ has a solution?
well it takes me to the menu displayed by the live-cd (try ubuntu, install ubuntu, etc)
what GPU do you use?
tried the boot option:  nouveau.blacklist=1
did you MD5 test the ISO you downloaded?
this iso has worked before
did you butn the CD as sowly as possible (assuming you are using a CD)
is the ram healthy? there is a memtester on the CD
every option in the CD just boots back into the menu
not a good sign. I'd rebuurn the CD as sowly as possible again
do you see red lines in the bottom right of the screen, like this: http://www.mynetnuke.com/Portals/28/images/Articles/MemtestMNN.jpg
yep
your ram is bad
if you have multiple sticks, remove one with the power OFF and rerun the test, see if you get no rednes, if its still red, put it back in with the power OFF and remove a different one
it's a laptop
stil l has ram. they make the ram easy to access for easy upgrades
so i removed the first stick and it seemed to do the trick, back to normal, thanks
bad ram will affect al the system as the apps run in ram
its one reason why memtest is on the CD, RAM is stupidly cheap so you can slam another stick in later
what could cause the ram to get like this? now i'm not sure if it was the ram in itself or the structure it was holding it since a piece below the left clip is broken
age, voltage fluctuations (suden power offs), cheap ram
is there a way to deactivate a RAM stick, so that there is no need to remove it?
unless your BIOS supports it, no
some server motherboards can deactivate CPU and RAM slots so you can swap parts out
